text: I feel like this was asked already but I can't find where. Do you have recommendations for a decent (not super expensive) ergonomic keyboard?

elements.text: I feel like this was asked already but I can't find where. Do you have recommendations for a decent (not super expensive) ergonomic keyboard?

text: I don't really have special requirements (doesn't need to be mechanical, esp. given that working at home I'd prefer something not super noisy), and I guess it doesn't have to have a numeric keypad (I don't remember ever using it).

elements.text: I don't really have special requirements (doesn't need to be mechanical, esp. given that working at home I'd prefer something not super noisy), and I guess it doesn't have to have a numeric keypad (I don't remember ever using it).

text: There was a lengthy discussion on Zulip that might help: <https://julialang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/225582-random/topic/Keyboard.20recommendations>

elements.text: There was a lengthy discussion on Zulip that might help:

text: Most of the keyboards discussed there are >$300

elements.text: Most of the keyboards discussed there are >$300

text:
but if you spend all day on a keyboard, AND if it helps reduce strain, I do think it's well worth the investment. Doctor's appointments can also expensive. :wink:
And even if it takes years to catch up...I knew an elderly piano player once, who lost the ability to play because of arthritis.
